text: Norway was represented by Grethe Kausland and Benny Borg, with the song '"Småting", at the 1972 Eurovision Song Contest, which took place on 25 March in Edinburgh. "Småting" was chosen as the Norwegian entry at the Melodi Grand Prix on 19 February. ==Final== The MGP was held at the studios of broadcaster NRK in Oslo, hosted by Vidar Lønn-Arnesen. Five songs were presented in the final with each song sung twice by different singers, once with a small combo and once with a full orchestra. The winning song was chosen by voting from a 14-member public jury who each awarded between 1 and 5 points per song.ESC National Finals database 1972 {| class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |+ style="font-size: bigger;" | MGP - 19 February 1972 |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! "Småting" was a rather old-fashioned song, lyrically very similar in theme to the previous year's "Lykken er", and at the close of voting had picked up 73 points, placing Norway 14th of the 18 entries.ESC History - Norway 1972 ==See also== *Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest *Eurovision Song Contest 1972 == References == Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1972 Category:Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest Category:1972 in Norwegian music Category:1972 in Norwegian television
